page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO PENSARN
page.content: Pensarn is an offshoot area of Abergele. It has all the trappings of a small village: grocer's, {supermarket,}post office, newsagents, hairdresser's, general store, catalogue shop, pubs and a garage.The only thing which divides Pensarn from Abergele is a by-pass. Pensarn has a{railway station}which may be closed down in the future as it is uneconomical. However, one source of finance Pensarn can be certain of is the stretch of beach. There are two cafes, a block of Victorian-style toilets, two amusement arcades, a tiny fair and a caravan site. There are also day chalets, many seating facilities and an Information Bureau, all catering for the tourist and his pocket. But, Pensarn, like other beaches along the coast, has fallen foul of{pollution.
